update.description:
This merge was a little tricky because some camera intrinsics work from pull request #2058 was backported to gazebo9 in pull request #3099 with some changes. Per this [prior discussion](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3099/backport-camera-intrinsics-feature/diff#comment-103358103):

gazebo10 has protected members:

    Camera::cameraProjectiveMatrix
    Camera::cameraUsingIntrinsics

while gazebo9 has

    CameraPrivate::cameraProjectionMatrix (note change from Projective -> Projection)
    CameraPrivate::cameraUsingIntrinsics

Following the suggestion from @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} in that comment thread, I've done the following:

* changed the code to use the protected members
* removed the private members added in pull request #3099
* added the `Camera::BuildProjectionMatrix` function alongside `Camera::BuildProjectiveMatrix`
* changed `Camera::BuildProjectiveMatrix` to call `Camera::BuildProjectionMatrix` internally
* added a doxygen `\deprecated` tag to `Camera::BuildProjectiveMatrix`, though we won't officially deprecate it until the `default` branch

Checking CI and awaiting review of the conflict merging from @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5}.
update.title: Merge 9 -> 10

content.raw: cool, I'll check in with you about deprecations and renaming stuff on the default branch after we merge this forward
content.html: cool, I'll check in with you about deprecations and renaming stuff on the default branch after we merge this forward

content.raw: I put the gazebo10 branch through 2 nights of overnight testing, and I see lots of these failures, so I think it's a pre-existing issue and that this should be safe to merge
content.html: I put the gazebo10 branch through 2 nights of overnight testing, and I see lots of these failures, so I think it's a pre-existing issue and that this should be safe to merge

content.raw:
I can reproduce the failure on `gazebo10`, but this branch caused 11 test failures in this CI build:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/1100/

I'll do a little more testing to see if I think the failures are more frequent or about the same
content.html:
I can reproduce the failure on gazebo10, but this branch caused 11 test failures in this CI build:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/1100/

I'll do a little more testing to see if I think the failures are more frequent or about the same

content.raw: the changes in Camera class look good to me.
content.html: the changes in Camera class look good to me.

content.raw: I managed to reproduce with `INTEGRAITON_physics_link`. So it looks like it’s already a problem on gazebo10 \(assuming it came from pull request #2922\). Should we ticket an issue for this so we don’t block this merge?
content.html: I managed to reproduce with INTEGRAITON_physics_link. So it looks like it’s already a problem on gazebo10 (assuming it came from pull request #2922). Should we ticket an issue for this so we don’t block this merge?

content.raw: it was much more frequent in the gpu-none build; I'll try running the tests with an invalid `DISPLAY` variable and see if that makes it reproduce more often
content.html: it was much more frequent in the gpu-none build; I'll try running the tests with an invalid DISPLAY variable and see if that makes it reproduce more often

content.raw: it was pretty frequent in both xenial CI builds. I had to run the physics_base test over 100 times to get the backtrace, though I suspect other tests fail more often.
content.html: it was pretty frequent in both xenial CI builds. I had to run the physics_base test over 100 times to get the backtrace, though I suspect other tests fail more often.

content.raw: I ran `INTEGRATION_physics_base` 20 times but was not able to reproduce it locally. Does the crash happen for you frequently?
content.html: I ran INTEGRATION_physics_base 20 times but was not able to reproduce it locally. Does the crash happen for you frequently?

content.raw:
I'm seeing a lot of test failures in CI with console output like the following:

~~~
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'boost::exception_detail::clone_impl<boost::exception_detail::error_info_injector<boost::thread_resource_error> >'
  what():  boost thread: trying joining itself: Resource deadlock avoided
~~~

I collected some backtraces locally that contain the following:

~~~
#8  0x00007f9fc22e3190 in boost::thread_exception::~thread_exception (this=<optimized out>, __in_chrg=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/boost/thread/exceptions.hpp:60
#9  boost::thread_resource_error::~thread_resource_error (this=<optimized out>, __in_chrg=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/boost/thread/exceptions.hpp:145
#10 boost::thread::join (this=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/boost/thread/detail/thread.hpp:763
#11 gazebo::transport::IOManager::Stop (this=this@entry=0x7f9f88003610) at gazebo/transport/IOManager.cc:53
#12 0x00007f9fc22e31b2 in gazebo::transport::IOManager::~IOManager (this=0x7f9f88003610, __in_chrg=<optimized out>) at gazebo/transport/IOManager.cc:37
#13 0x00007f9fc22c2fee in gazebo::transport::Connection::~Connection (this=0x7f9f80000e30, __in_chrg=<optimized out>) at gazebo/transport/Connection.cc:135
...
#27 gazebo::common::details::WeakBinder<boost::_bi::bind_t<void, boost::_mfi::mf1<void, gazebo::transport::Connection, boost::system::error_code const&>, boost::_bi::list2<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::transport::Connection*>, boost::arg<1> (*)()> >, gazebo::transport::Connection>::operator()<boost::system::error_code const&> (this=0x7f9f87ffe030) at gazebo/common/WeakBind.hh:82
#28 boost::asio::detail::binder1<gazebo::common::details::WeakBinder<boost::_bi::bind_t<void, boost::_mfi::mf1<void, gazebo::transport::Connection, boost::system::error_code const&>, boost::_bi::list2<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::transport::Connection*>, boost::arg<1> (*)()> >, gazebo::transport::Connection>, boost::system::error_code>::operator() (this=0x7f9f87ffe030) at /usr/include/boost/asio/detail/bind_handler.hpp:47
#29 boost::asio::asio_handler_invoke<boost::asio::detail::binder1<gazebo::common::details::WeakBinder<boost::_bi::bind_t<void, boost::_mfi::mf1<void, gazebo::transport::Connection, boost::system::error_code const&>, boost::_bi::list2<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::transport::Connection*>, boost::arg<1> (*)()> >, gazebo::transport::Connection>, boost::system::error_code> > (function=...) at /usr/include/boost/asio/handler_invoke_hook.hpp:69
#30 boost_asio_handler_invoke_helpers::invoke<boost::asio::detail::binder1<gazebo::common::details::WeakBinder<boost::_bi::bind_t<void, boost::_mfi::mf1<void, gazebo::transport::Connection, boost::system::error_code const&>, boost::_bi::list2<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::transport::Connection*>, boost::arg<1> (*)()> >, gazebo::transport::Connection>, boost::system::error_code>, gazebo::common::details::WeakBinder<boost::_bi::bind_t<void, boost::_mfi::mf1<void, gazebo::transport::Connection, boost::system::error_code const&>, boost::_bi::list2<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::transport::Connection*>, boost::arg<1> (*)()> >, gazebo::transport::Connection> > (context=..., function=...) at /usr/include/boost/asio/detail/handler_invoke_helpers.hpp:37
#31 boost::asio::detail::reactive_socket_accept_op<boost::asio::basic_socket<boost::asio::ip::tcp, boost::asio::stream_socket_service<boost::asio::ip::tcp> >, boost::asio::ip::tcp, gazebo::common::details::WeakBinder<boost::_bi::bind_t<void, boost::_mfi::mf1<void, gazebo::transport::Connection, boost::system::error_code const&>, boost::_bi::list2<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::transport::Connection*>, boost::arg<1> (*)()> >, gazebo::transport::Connection> >::do_complete (owner=<optimized out>, base=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/boost/asio/detail/reactive_socket_accept_op.hpp:123
~~~

I think the main difference on gazebo10 might be from pull request #2922?

#30 boost_asio_handler_invoke_helpers::invoke<boost::asio::detail::binder1<gazebo::common::details::WeakBinder<boost::_bi::bind_t<void, boost::_mfi::mf1<void, gazebo::transport::Connection, boost::system::error_code const&>, boost::_bi::list2<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::transport::Connection*>, boost::arg<1> (*)()> >, gazebo::transport::Connection>, boost::system::error_code>, gazebo::common::details::WeakBinder<boost::_bi::bind_t<void, boost::_mfi::mf1<void, gazebo::transport::Connection, boost::system::error_code const&>, boost::_bi::list2<boost::_bi::value<gazebo::transport::Connection*>, boost::arg<1> (*)()> >, gazebo::transport::Connection> > (context=..., function=...) at /usr/include/boost/asio/detail/handler_invoke_helpers.hpp:37

update.description:
This merge was a little tricky because some camera intrinsics work from pull request #2058 was backported to gazebo9 in pull request #3099 with some changes. Per this [prior discussion](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3099/backport-camera-intrinsics-feature/diff#comment-103358103):

gazebo10 has protected members:

    Camera::cameraProjectiveMatrix
    Camera::cameraUsingIntrinsics

while gazebo9 has

    CameraPrivate::cameraProjectionMatrix (note change from Projective -> Projection)
    CameraPrivate::cameraUsingIntrinsics

Following the suggestion from @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} in that comment thread, I've done the following:

* changed the code to use the protected members
* removed the private members added in pull request #3099
* added the `Camera::BuildProjectionMatrix` function alongside `Camera::BuildProjectiveMatrix`
* changed `Camera::BuildProjectiveMatrix` to call `Camera::BuildProjectionMatrix` internally
* added a doxygen `\deprecated` tag to `Camera::BuildProjectiveMatrix`, though we won't officially deprecate it until the `default` branch

Checking CI and awaiting review of the conflict merging from @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5}.
